channel.title: My game, I am sticking with it
channel.description:
Well lately i have wanted to dig myself out of many holes, and one thought was to create something partly challenging. I have made a login client and server. With many thanks to proto for giving me the reference to understand. When logged in it sends 2 packets to the server and the server responds and sends pack that everything is a-ok.
[img]http://img468.imageshack.us/img468/9056/newgameho3.png[/img]
I am sticking with this project. Eventually connecting it to a update server i have set.
I am taking a break for about a day to develop a quick and simple 2 person chatroom for a quick refresher of what im doing.
If you dont have anything nice to say, dont post at all. I know that it isnt much, but is alot for me to process for the time being.

item.title: My game, I am sticking with it
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:144622”][quote author=White Castle link=topic=197981.msg1765018#msg1765018 date=1190109843]
In my humble experience, it is usually better to make the game first and then build the login interface around that.
[/quote]
i was just about to post this, seeing as thats how i made pokemons, i made the walking etc before making it connect anywhere, its a lot easier to test and etc without having to connect somewhere[/quote]

Hey lawl, you wouldn’t happen to still have that Multiplayer Pokemon source would you ?

Read full topic
item.source: My game, I am sticking with it

item.title: My game, I am sticking with it
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

In relation to a game, I would consider baby steps “rendering terrain”, “loading a world”, “implementing an inventory system”, etc…

However, OP: nice work, good luck.
